title: How to drive word of mouth | Nilan Peiris (CPO of Wise)
key_insights: OpenAI operates with extreme bottom-up autonomy, but this only works with exceptionally high talent caliber
The key to Codex's success was starting with IDE integration rather than jumping to fully autonomous cloud-based agents
Code review and validation, not code writing, is becoming the primary bottleneck for AI-accelerated development
The best coding agents should be given the hardest problems, not easy tasks, to demonstrate their value
Human typing speed and review capacity are currently the limiting factors for AGI productivity gains
Successful AI products require tight integration between product, research, and model training teams
The future of agents likely involves them writing code to interact with computers rather than using GUI automation
Early retention metrics and Reddit feedback are more valuable than internal dogfooding for AI product development

guest_background.current_role: Product Lead for Codex at OpenAI

topics_discussed: The evolution from Codex Cloud to IDE integration
Building the Sora Android app in 28 days with Codex
Code review vs code writing as productivity bottlenecks
Training models specifically for coding tasks
Context window management and compaction features
The future of software engineering careers

Team hiring and scaling at OpenAI
The importance of user feedback and social media monitoring
memorable_quotes: Codex is a bit like this really smart intern that refuses to read Slack, doesn't check Datadog unless you ask it to.
The current underappreciated limiting factor is literally human typing speed or human multitasking speed.
If you want to build any agent, maybe you should be building a coding agent.

summary: Alexander Embiricos shares how OpenAI built Codex into a 20x growing coding agent, revealing insights about AI product development, the future of software engineering, and how teams can dramatically accelerate productivity with AI coding tools. The conversation provides a rare inside look at OpenAI's bottom-up culture and practical advice for leveraging AI agents effectively.
